author: Zack Widup
full_text:
I hadn't heard the term before, but from the literature I've seen it is a
source of electromagnetic energy that sweeps from 0 to 250 Hz. It probably
uses a loop as the field source and wouldn't have much of a range. You could
probably build one for $20 or less depending on how knowledgeable you were
and how good a scrounger. Using a microcontroller and scrounged parts it
might be as low as $5 to build. I'm an EE by profession; I can think of
several ways to go about it.
It's not the same as Frank's box or any other receiver. It isn't a receiver.
I guess it is either supposed to enhance reception or actually attract
ghosts as an energy source.

Zack
